The e: mail claim states that there will be a 3.8% sales tax on all real estate transactions after 2012. The expert's verdict clarifies that this is false and misleading because the tax only applies to the profit from the sale, not the sales price itself.
The expert: s verdict mentions that the tax only kicks in if the property being sold is not the primary residence, such as a second home, vacation home, or rental property. For primary residences, individuals can make a profit of up to $250,000 ($500,000 for couples) before the tax applies. This aspect further reinforces that the tax is targeted at high-income individuals and not the average homeowner.
